intro: Traversia, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pale blue petals. The plants typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Traversia species are often found in mountainous regions and have a compact, low-growing habit. They are popular in horticulture for their ornamental value and drought tolerance.
